   19: %%
   20: -module(match_no_copt_ssa_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 pmatch/1,mixed/1,aliases/1,non_matching_aliases/1,
   25: 	 match_in_call/1,untuplify/1,shortcut_boolean/1,letify_guard/1,
   26: 	 selectify/1,deselectify/1,underscore/1,match_map/1,map_vars_used/1,
   27: 	 coverage/1,grab_bag/1,literal_binary/1,
   28:          unary_op/1,eq_types/1,match_after_return/1,match_right_tuple/1,
   29:          tuple_size_in_try/1,match_boolean_list/1,
   30:          heisen_variables/1,
   31:          mutable_variables/1]).
   32: 	 
   33: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   34: 
   35: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   36: 
   37: all() -> 
   38:     [{group,p}].
   39: 
   40: groups() -> 
   41:     [{p,[parallel],
   42:       [pmatch,mixed,aliases,non_matching_aliases,
   43:        match_in_call,untuplify,
   44:        shortcut_boolean,letify_guard,selectify,deselectify,
   45:        underscore,match_map,map_vars_used,coverage,
   46:        grab_bag,literal_binary,unary_op,eq_types,
   47:        match_after_return,match_right_tuple,
   48:        tuple_size_in_try,match_boolean_list,
   49:        heisen_variables,
   50:        mutable_variables]}].
   51: 
   52: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   53:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   54:     Config.
   55: 
   56: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   57:     ok.
   58: 
   59: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: 
   66: pmatch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   67:     ok = doit(1),
   68:     ok = doit(2),
   69:     {error,baz} = doit(3),
   70:     {error,foobar} = doit(4),
   71:     ok.
   72: 
   73: %% Thanks to Tobias Lindahl (HiPE).
   74: -define(FOO(X),
   75: 	case X of
   76: 	    1 -> foo;
   77: 	    2 -> bar;
   78: 	    3 -> baz;
   79: 	    4 -> foobar
   80: 	end).
   81: 
   82: doit(X) ->
   83:     case ?FOO(X) of
   84: 	foo -> ok;
   85: 	bar -> ok;
   86: 	Other -> {error, Other}
   87:     end.
   88: 
   89: mixed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   90:     glufs = mixit(1),
   91:     klafs = mixit(2),
   92:     fnurra = mixit(3),
   93:     usch = mixit(4),
   94:     {error,blurf} = mixit(5),
   95:     {error,87987987} = mixit(6),
   96:     {error,{a,b,c}} = mixit(7),
   97:     no_match = mixed_1(),
   98:     ok.
   99: 
  100: mixit(X) ->
  101:     case case X of
  102: 	     1 -> a;
  103: 	     2 -> b;
  104: 	     3 -> 42;
  105: 	     4 -> 77;
  106: 	     4+1 -> blurf;
  107: 	     5+1 -> 87987987;
  108: 	     6+1 -> {a,b,c}
  109: 	 end of
  110: 	a -> glufs;
  111: 	b -> klafs;
  112: 	42 -> fnurra;
  113: 	77 -> usch;
  114: 	Other -> {error,Other}
  115:     end.
  116: 
  117: mixed_1() ->
  118:     case 0 of
  119:         0.0 ->
  120:             %% This clause must not match.
  121:             zero;
  122:         0.5 ->
  123:             half;
  124:         _ ->
  125:             no_match
  126:     end.
  127: 
  128: aliases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  129:     %% Lists/strings.
  130:     ok = str_alias("abc"),
  131:     ok = str_alias("def"),
  132:     ok = str_alias("ghi"),
  133:     ok = str_alias("klm"),
  134:     ok = str_alias("qrs"),
  135:     ok = str_alias("xy"),
  136:     ok = str_alias(""),
  137:     ok = str_alias([]),
  138:     error = str_alias("blurf"),
  139: 
  140:     %% Characters/integers.
  141:     ok = char_alias($v),
  142:     ok = char_alias(118),
  143:     ok = char_alias($w),
  144:     ok = char_alias(119),
  145:     ok = char_alias(42),
  146:     ok = char_alias(3.0),
  147:     error = char_alias($_),
  148:     error = char_alias(0),
  149: 
  150:     {42,42,42} = three(42),
  151: 
  152:     {1,42,99,1,42,99} = tuple_alias({1,42,99}),
  153:     {-10,20,-10,20,-10,20} = tuple_alias({-10,20}),
  154:     6 = tup_lit_alias({1,2,3}),
  155:     6 = tup_lit_alias_rev({1,2,3}),
  156: 
  157:     {1,2,3,4} = list_in_tuple({container, [1,2,3], 4}),
  158:     {a,b,c,d} = list_in_tuple({container, [a,b,c], d}),
  159: 
  160:     {13,y,13,17,x,{y,13},17} = tuple_in_tuple({x, {y,13}, 17}),
  161:     {a,y,a,b,x,{y,a},b} = tuple_in_tuple({x, {y,a}, b}),
  162: 
  163:     {42,42,42,42} = multiple_aliases_1(id(42)),
  164:     {7,7,7} = multiple_aliases_2(id(7)),
  165:     {{a,b},{a,b},{a,b}} = multiple_aliases_3(id({a,b})),
  166:     {[x,y,z],[x,y,z],[x,y,z]} = multiple_aliases_4(id([x,y,z])),
  167: 
  168:     %% Lists/literals.
  169:     {a,b} = list_alias(id([a,b])),
  170: 
  171:     %% Multiple matches.
  172:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,home},_}} =
  173:         (catch fun() ->
  174:                        Rec = (42 = V) = home,
  175:                        {Rec,V}
  176:                end()),
  177:     {home,home} =
  178:         fun() ->
  179:                 Rec = (home = V) = home,
  180:                 {Rec,V}
  181:         end(),
  182:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,16},_}} =
  183:         (catch fun(B) ->
  184:                        <<42:V>> = V = B
  185:                end(16)),
  186:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,0},_}} =
  187:         (catch fun() ->
  188:                        <<2:V>> = V = 0
  189:                end()),
  190:     {42,42} =
  191:         fun(E) ->
  192:                 Rec = (42 = V) = id(E),
  193:                 {Rec,V}
  194:         end(42),
  195: 
  196:     ok.
  197: 
  198: str_alias(V) ->
  199:     Res = str_alias_1(V),
  200:     Res = str_alias_2(V).
  201: 
  202: str_alias_1([$a,$b,$c]="abc"="a"++[$b,$c]=[97,98,99]) -> ok;
  203: str_alias_1([$d|"ef"]="def") -> ok;
  204: str_alias_1([$g|"hi"]="g"++"hi"="gh"++"i"="ghi"++"") -> ok;
  205: str_alias_1("k"++"lm"=[$k|"lm"]) -> ok;
  206: str_alias_1([113,114,115]="qrs"=[$q,$r,$s]="q"++"r"++"s") -> ok;
  207: str_alias_1([$x,$y]="xy") -> ok;
  208: str_alias_1(""=[]) -> ok;
  209: str_alias_1(_) -> error.
  210: 
  211: %% Make sure that different line numbers do not matter.
  212: 
  213: str_alias_2([$a,$b,$c]=
  214: 	    "abc"=
  215: 	    "a"++[$b,$c
  216: 	       ]=
  217: 	    [97,98,99
  218: 	  ]) -> ok;
  219: str_alias_2([$d|"ef"]=
  220: 	  "def") -> ok;
  221: str_alias_2([$g|"hi"]=
  222: 	  "g"++"hi"=
  223: 	  "gh"++"i"=
  224: 	  "ghi"++"") -> ok;
  225: str_alias_2("k"++"lm"=
  226: 	  [$k|"lm"
  227: 	  ]) -> ok;
  228: str_alias_2([113,114,115]=
  229: 	  "qrs"=[$q,$r,$s
  230: 		]=
  231: 	  "q"++"r"++"s") -> ok;
  232: str_alias_2([$x,$y]=
  233: 	  "xy") -> ok;
  234: str_alias_2(""=
  235: 	  []) -> ok;
  236: str_alias_2(_) -> error.
  237: 
  238: char_alias(V) ->
  239:     Res = char_alias_1(V),
  240:     Res = char_alias_2(V).
  241: 
  242: char_alias_1(118=$v) -> ok;
  243: char_alias_1($w=119) -> ok;
  244: char_alias_1(42=42) -> ok;
  245: char_alias_1(3.0=3.0) -> ok;
  246: char_alias_1(_) -> error.
  247: 
  248: char_alias_2(118=
  249: 	     $v) -> ok;
  250: char_alias_2($w=
  251: 	     119) -> ok;
  252: char_alias_2(42=
  253: 	     42) -> ok;
  254: char_alias_2(3.0=
  255: 	     3.0) -> ok;
  256: char_alias_2(_) -> error.
  257: 
  258: three(V) ->
  259:     Res = three_1(V),
  260:     Res = three_2(V).
  261: 
  262: three_1(A=B=C) ->
  263:     {A,B,C}.
  264: 
  265: three_2(A=
  266: 	B=
  267: 	C) ->
  268:     {A,B,C}.
  269: 
  270: tuple_alias(Expr) ->
  271:     Res = tuple_alias_a(Expr),
  272:     Res = tuple_alias_b(Expr).
  273: 
  274: tuple_alias_a({A,B,C} = {X,Y,Z}) ->
  275:     {A,B,C,X,Y,Z};
  276: tuple_alias_a({A,B} = {C,D} = {E,F}) ->
  277:     {A,B,C,D,E,F}.
  278: 
  279: tuple_alias_b({_,_,_}=Expr) ->
  280:     {A,B,C} = {X,Y,Z} = Expr,
  281:     {A,B,C,X,Y,Z};
  282: tuple_alias_b({_,_}=Expr) ->
  283:     {A,B} = {C,D} = {E,F} = Expr,
  284:     {A,B,C,D,E,F}.
  285: 
  286: tup_lit_alias({A,B,C}={1,2,3}) ->
  287:     A+B+C.
  288: 
  289: tup_lit_alias_rev({1,2,3}={A,B,C}) ->
  290:     A+B+C.
  291: 
  292: list_in_tuple(E) ->
  293:     Res = list_in_tuple_a(E),
  294:     Res = list_in_tuple_b(E).
  295: 
  296: list_in_tuple_a({container, [_,_,_] = [A,B,C], D}) ->
  297:     {A,B,C,D}.
  298: 
  299: list_in_tuple_b(E) ->
  300:     {container, [_,_,_] = [A,B,C], D} = E,
  301:     {A,B,C,D}.
  302: 
  303: tuple_in_tuple(Expr) ->
  304:     Res = tuple_in_tuple_a(Expr),
  305:     Res = tuple_in_tuple_b(Expr).
  306: 
  307: tuple_in_tuple_a({x, {y,A} = {B,C}, D} = {E, F, G}) ->
  308:     {A,B,C,D,E,F,G}.
  309: 
  310: tuple_in_tuple_b(Expr) ->
  311:     {x, {y,A} = {B,C}, D} = {E, F, G} = Expr,
  312:     {A,B,C,D,E,F,G}.
  313: 
  314: multiple_aliases_1(Expr) ->
  315:     Res = multiple_aliases_1a(Expr),
  316:     Res = multiple_aliases_1b(Expr).
  317: 
  318: multiple_aliases_1a((A=B) = (C=D)) ->
  319:     {A,B,C,D}.
  320: 
  321: multiple_aliases_1b(Expr) ->
  322:     (A=B) = (C=D) = Expr,
  323:     {A,B,C,D}.
  324: 
  325: multiple_aliases_2((A=B) = (A=C)) ->
  326:     {A,B,C}.
  327: 
  328: multiple_aliases_3(Expr) ->
  329:     Res = multiple_aliases_3a(Expr),
  330:     Res = multiple_aliases_3b(Expr).
  331: 
  332: multiple_aliases_3a((A={_,_}=B)={_,_}=C) ->
  333:     {A,B,C}.
  334: 
  335: multiple_aliases_3b(Expr) ->
  336:     (A={_,_}=B) = {_,_} = C = Expr,
  337:     {A,B,C}.
  338: 
  339: multiple_aliases_4(Expr) ->
  340:     Res = multiple_aliases_4a(Expr),
  341:     Res = multiple_aliases_4b(Expr).
  342: 
  343: multiple_aliases_4a((A=[_,_,_]=B) = [_,_,_] = C) ->
  344:     {A,B,C}.
  345: 
  346: multiple_aliases_4b(Expr) ->
  347:     (A=[_,_,_]=B) = [_,_,_] = C = Expr,
  348:     {A,B,C}.
  349: 
  350: list_alias(Expr) ->
  351:     Res = list_alias1a(Expr),
  352:     Res = list_alias1b(Expr),
  353:     Res = list_alias2a(Expr),
  354:     Res = list_alias2b(Expr),
  355:     Res = list_alias3a(Expr),
  356:     Res = list_alias3b(Expr).
  357: 
  358: list_alias1a([a,b]=[X,Y]) ->
  359:     {X,Y}.
  360: 
  361: list_alias1b(Expr) ->
  362:     [a,b] = [X,Y] = Expr,
  363:     {X,Y}.
  364: 
  365: list_alias2a([X,Y]=[a,b]) ->
  366:     {X,Y}.
  367: 
  368: list_alias2b(Expr) ->
  369:     [X,Y] = [a,b] = Expr,
  370:     {X,Y}.
  371: 
  372: list_alias3a([X,b]=[a,Y]) ->
  373:     {X,Y}.
  374: 
  375: list_alias3b(Expr) ->
  376:     [X,b] = [a,Y]= Expr,
  377:     {X,Y}.
  378: 
  379: non_matching_aliases(_Config) ->
  380:     none = mixed_aliases(<<42>>),
  381:     none = mixed_aliases([b]),
  382:     none = mixed_aliases([d]),
  383:     none = mixed_aliases({a,42}),
  384:     none = mixed_aliases(42),
  385:     none = mixed_aliases(<<6789:16>>),
  386:     none = mixed_aliases(#{key=>value}),
  387: 
  388:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,bar},_}} = (catch plus_plus_prefix()),
  389:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,42},_}} = (catch nomatch_alias(42)),
  390:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,job},_}} = (catch entirely()),
  391:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,associates},_}} = (catch printer()),
  392:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,borogoves},_}} = (catch tench()),
  393: 
  394:     put(perch, 0),
  395:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,{spine,42}},_}} = (catch perch(42)),
  396:     1 = erase(perch),
  397: 
  398:     put(salmon, 0),
  399:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,mimsy},_}} = (catch salmon()),
  400:     1 = erase(salmon),
  401: 
  402:     put(shark, 0),
  403:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,_},_}} = (catch shark()),
  404:     1 = erase(shark),
  405: 
  406:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,_},_}} = (catch radio(research)),
  407: 
  408:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,whatever},_}} = (catch pike1(whatever)),
  409:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,whatever},_}} = (catch pike2(whatever)),
  410: 
  411:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = catch squid(a),
  412:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,43},_}} = catch squid(42),
  413: 
  414:     ok.
  415: 
  416: mixed_aliases(<<X:8>> = x) -> {a,X};
  417: mixed_aliases([b] = <<X:8>>) -> {b,X};
  418: mixed_aliases(<<X:8>> = {a,X}) -> {c,X};
  419: mixed_aliases([X] = <<X:8>>) -> {d,X};
  420: mixed_aliases(<<X:16>> = X) -> {e,X};
  421: mixed_aliases(X = <<X:16>>) -> {f,X};
  422: mixed_aliases(<<X:16,_/binary>> = X) -> {g,X};
  423: mixed_aliases(X = <<X:16,_/binary>>) -> {h,X};
  424: mixed_aliases(X = #{key:=X}) -> {i,X};
  425: mixed_aliases(#{key:=X} = X) -> {j,X};
  426: mixed_aliases([X] = #{key:=X}) -> {k,X};
  427: mixed_aliases(#{key:=X} = [X]) -> {l,X};
  428: mixed_aliases({a,X} = #{key:=X}) -> {m,X};
  429: mixed_aliases(#{key:=X} = {a,X}) -> {n,X};
  430: mixed_aliases([] ++ (foo = [])) -> o;
  431: mixed_aliases(_) -> none.
  432: 
  433: plus_plus_prefix() ->
  434:     [] ++ (foo = []) = bar.
  435: 
  436: nomatch_alias(I) ->
  437:     {ok={A,B}} = id(I),
  438:     {A,B}.
  439: 
  440: entirely() ->
  441:     0(((Voice = true) = cool) = job),
  442:     [receive _ -> Voice end || banking <- printer].
  443: 
  444: printer() ->
  445:     {[_Indoor] = [] = associates},
  446:     [ireland || _Indoor <- _Indoor].
  447: 
  448: tench() ->
  449:     E = begin
  450: 	    [A] = [] = borogoves,
  451: 	    A + 1
  452: 	end,
  453:     E + 7 * A.
  454: 
  455: perch(X) ->
  456:     begin
  457: 	put(perch, get(perch)+1),
  458: 	[_A] = [] = {spine,X}
  459:     end.
  460: 
  461: salmon() ->
  462:     {put(salmon, get(salmon)+1),#{key:=([A]=[])}=mimsy,exit(fail)},
  463:     A + 10.
  464: 
  465: shark() ->
  466:     (hello = there) = (catch shark(put(shark, get(shark)+1), a = b)).
  467: 
  468: shark(_, _) ->
  469:     ok.
  470: 
  471: radio(research) ->
  472:     (connection = proof) =
  473: 	(catch erlang:trace_pattern(catch mechanisms + assist,
  474: 				    summary = mechanisms)).
  475: 
  476: pike1(X) ->
  477:     case id([]) of
  478:         [] ->
  479:             case X of
  480:                 [Var] = [] ->
  481:                     ok
  482:             end
  483:     end,
  484:     Var.
  485: 
  486: pike2(X) ->
  487:     case id([]) of
  488:         [] ->
  489:             case X of
  490:                 [_] = [] ->
  491:                     Var = 42
  492:             end
  493:     end,
  494:     Var.
  495: 
  496: squid(E) ->
  497:     ([X] = {Y}) = V = E + 1,
  498:     {V,X + Y}.
  499: 
  500: 
  501: %% OTP-7018.
  502: 
  503: match_in_call(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  504:     mac_a(0),
  505:     mac_b(1),
  506:     mac_c(42),
  507:     mac_d(42),
  508:     mac_e({gurka,42}),
  509: 
  510:     [{2,2},{2,2}] = mac_lc([{2,any},{2,2}]),
  511:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch mac_lc([{1,1}])),
  512: 
  513:     ok.
  514: 
  515: mac_a(X) ->
  516:     id(_Gurka = {gurka,X}),
  517:     ok.
  518: 
  519: mac_b(X) ->
  520:     id(Gurka = {gurka,X}),
  521:     gurka(Gurka, X),
  522:     ok.
  523: 
  524: mac_c(X) ->
  525:     id(Gurka = Yxa = {gurka,X}),
  526:     id({Gurka,Yxa}),
  527:     ok.
  528: 
  529: mac_d(X) ->
  530:     id({gurka,42} = {gurka,X}),
  531:     ok.
  532: 
  533: mac_e(X) ->
  534:     id({gurka,42} = X),
  535:     ok.
  536: 
  537: mac_lc(E) ->
  538:     Res = mac_lc1(E),
  539:     Res = mac_lc2(E).
  540: 
  541: mac_lc1(E) ->
  542:     [{X,Y} ||
  543: 	{X,_} <- E,
  544: 	(Y = X) =:= (Y = 1 + 1)].
  545: 
  546: mac_lc2(E) ->
  547:     [{X,Y} ||
  548: 	{X,_} <- E,
  549: 	(Y = X) =:= (Y = 2)].
  550: 
  551: gurka({gurka,X}, X) -> ok.
  552: 
  553: 
  554: untuplify(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  555:     %% We do this to cover sys_core_fold:unalias_pat/1.
  556:     {1,2,3,4,alias,{[1,2],{3,4},alias}} = untuplify_1([1,2], {3,4}, alias),
  557:     error = untuplify_1([1,2], {3,4}, 42),
  558: 
  559:     %% Test that a previous bug in v3_codegen is gone. (The sinking of
  560:     %% stack frames into only the case arms that needed them was not always
  561:     %% safe.)
  562:     [33, -1, -33, 1] = untuplify_2(32, 65),
  563:     {33, 1, -33, -1} = untuplify_2(65, 32),
  564: 
  565:     ok.
  566: 
  567: untuplify_1(A, B, C) ->
  568:     case {A,B,C} of
  569: 	{[X,Y],{Z,W},alias=Alias}=Top ->
  570: 	    {X,Y,Z,W,Alias,Top};
  571: 	[_,_]=CantMatch ->
  572: 	    CantMatch;
  573: 	_ ->
  574: 	    error
  575:     end.
  576: 
  577: untuplify_2(V1, V2) ->
  578:     {D1,D2,D3,D4} =
  579:         if V1 > V2 ->
  580:                 %% The 1 value was overwritten by the value of V2-V1.
  581:                 {V1-V2,  1,  V2-V1, -1};
  582:            true ->
  583:                 {V2-V1, -1, V1-V2,  1}
  584:         end,
  585:     if
  586:         D2 > D4 ->
  587:             {D1, D2, D3, D4};
  588:         true ->
  589:             [D1, D2, D3, D4]
  590:     end.
  591: 
  592: %% Coverage of beam_dead:shortcut_boolean_label/4.
  593: shortcut_boolean(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  594:     false = shortcut_boolean_1([0]),
  595:     true = shortcut_boolean_1({42}),
  596:     'maybe' = shortcut_boolean_1(self()),
  597:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch shortcut_boolean_1([a,b])),
  598:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch shortcut_boolean_1({a,b})),
  599:     ok.
  600: 
  601: shortcut_boolean_1(X) ->
  602:     Outer = case not is_pid(X) of
  603: 		true ->
  604: 		    V = case X of
  605: 			    [_] -> true;
  606: 			    {_} -> false
  607: 			end,
  608: 		    not V;
  609: 		false ->
  610: 		    'maybe'
  611: 	    end,
  612:     id(Outer).
  613: 
  614: 
  615: %% Test sys_core_fold:letify_guard/3.
  616: letify_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  617:     {-15,a} = letify_guard(-15, a),
  618:     5 = letify_guard(2, 3),
  619:     ok.
  620: 
  621: letify_guard(A, B) ->
  622:     case {A,B} of
  623: 	%% The tuple will be built in the guard...
  624: 	Z when tuple_size(Z) =:= 2, element(1, Z) < 0 ->
  625: 	    %% ... and again here.
  626: 	    Z;
  627: 	{X,Y} -> X+Y
  628:     end.
  629: 
  630: %% Test combining of is_eq_exact instructions to select_val
  631: %% instructions in beam_dead and beam_peep.
  632: 
  633: selectify(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  634:     integer = sel_different_types({r,42}),
  635:     atom = sel_different_types({r,forty_two}),
  636:     float = sel_different_types({r,100.0}),
  637:     none = sel_different_types({r,18}),
  638:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch sel_different_types([a,b,c])),
  639: 
  640:     integer = sel_same_value({r,42}),
  641:     error = sel_same_value({r,100}),
  642:     error = sel_same_value(a),
  643: 
  644:     integer42 = sel_same_value2(42),
  645:     integer43 = sel_same_value2(43),
  646:     error = sel_same_value2(44),
  647: 
  648:     ok.
  649: 
  650: sel_different_types({r,_}=T) when element(2, T) =:= forty_two ->
  651:     atom;
  652: sel_different_types({r,_}=T) when element(2, T) =:= 42 ->
  653:     integer;
  654: sel_different_types({r,_}=T) when element(2, T) =:= 100.0 ->
  655:     float;
  656: sel_different_types({r,_}) ->
  657:     none.
  658: 
  659: sel_same_value({r,V}) when V =:= 42 ->
  660:     integer;
  661: sel_same_value({r,V}) when V =:= 42 ->
  662:     integer42;
  663: sel_same_value(_) ->
  664:     error.
  665: 
  666: sel_same_value2(V) when V =:= 42 ->
  667:     integer42;
  668: sel_same_value2(V) when V =:= 42; V =:= 43 ->
  669:     integer43;
  670: sel_same_value2(_) ->
  671:     error.
  672: 
  673: %% Test deconstruction of select_val instructions to regular tests
  674: %% with zero or one values left.
  675: 
  676: deselectify(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  677:     one_or_other = desel_tuple_arity({1}),
  678:     two = desel_tuple_arity({1,1}),
  679:     one_or_other = desel_tuple_arity({1,1,1}),
  680: 
  681:     one_or_other = dsel_integer(1),
  682:     two = dsel_integer(2),
  683:     one_or_other = dsel_integer(3),
  684: 
  685:     one_or_other = dsel_integer_typecheck(1),
  686:     two = dsel_integer_typecheck(2),
  687:     one_or_other = dsel_integer_typecheck(3),
  688: 
  689:     one_or_other = dsel_atom(one),
  690:     two = dsel_atom(two),
  691:     one_or_other = dsel_atom(three),
  692: 
  693:     one_or_other = dsel_atom_typecheck(one),
  694:     two = dsel_atom_typecheck(two),
  695:     one_or_other = dsel_atom_typecheck(three),
  696: 
  697:     %% Cover deconstruction of select_val instructions in
  698:     %% beam_peep.
  699: 
  700:     stop = dsel_peek_0(stop),
  701:     ignore = dsel_peek_0(ignore),
  702:     Config = dsel_peek_0(Config),
  703: 
  704:     stop = dsel_peek_1(stop, any),
  705:     Config = dsel_peek_1(ignore, Config),
  706:     other = dsel_peek_1(other, ignored),
  707: 
  708:     0 = dsel_peek_2(0, any),
  709:     Config = dsel_peek_2(1, Config),
  710:     2 = dsel_peek_2(2, ignored),
  711: 
  712:     true = dsel_peek_3(true),
  713:     false = dsel_peek_3(false),
  714:     {error,Config} = dsel_peek_3(Config),
  715: 
  716:     ok.
  717: 
  718: %% The following will be optimized by the sharing optimizations
  719: %% in beam_ssa_opt.
  720: 
  721: desel_tuple_arity(Tuple) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
  722:     case Tuple of
  723:         {_} -> one_or_other;
  724:         {_,_} -> two;
  725:         _ -> one_or_other
  726:     end.
  727: 
  728: dsel_integer(Val) ->
  729:     case Val of
  730:         1 -> one_or_other;
  731:         2 -> two;
  732:         _ -> one_or_other
  733:     end.
  734: 
  735: dsel_integer_typecheck(Val) when is_integer(Val) ->
  736:     case Val of
  737:         1 -> one_or_other;
  738:         2 -> two;
  739:         _ -> one_or_other
  740:     end.
  741: 
  742: dsel_atom(Val) ->
  743:     case Val of
  744:         one -> one_or_other;
  745:         two -> two;
  746:         _ -> one_or_other
  747:     end.
  748: 
  749: dsel_atom_typecheck(Val) when is_atom(Val) ->
  750:     case Val of
  751:         one -> one_or_other;
  752:         two -> two;
  753:         _ -> one_or_other
  754:     end.
  755: 
  756: %% The following functions are carefully crafted so that the sharing
  757: %% optimizations in beam_ssa_opt can't be applied. After applying the
  758: %% beam_jump:eliminate_moves/1 optimization and beam_clean:clean_labels/1
  759: %% has unified labels, beam_peep is able to optimize these functions.
  760: 
  761: dsel_peek_0(A0) ->
  762:     case id(A0) of
  763:         stop ->   stop;
  764:         ignore -> ignore;
  765:         A ->      A
  766:     end.
  767: 
  768: dsel_peek_1(A0, B) ->
  769:     case id(A0) of
  770:         stop ->   stop;
  771:         ignore -> B;
  772:         A ->      A
  773:     end.
  774: 
  775: dsel_peek_2(A0, B) ->
  776:     case id(A0) of
  777:         0 -> 0;
  778:         1 -> B;
  779:         A -> A
  780:     end.
  781: 
  782: dsel_peek_3(A0) ->
  783:     case id(A0) of
  784:         true ->  true;
  785:         false -> false;
  786:         Other -> {error,Other}
  787:     end.
  788: 
  789: underscore(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  790:     case Config of
  791: 	[] ->
  792: 	    %% Assignment to _ at the end of a construct.
  793: 	    _ = length(Config);
  794: 	[_|_] ->
  795: 	    %% Assignment to _ at the end of a construct.
  796: 	    _ = list_to_tuple(Config)
  797:     end,
  798:     _ = is_list(Config),
  799:     ok.
  800: 
  801: -record(s, {map,t}).
  802: 
  803: match_map(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  804:     Map = #{key=>{x,y},ignore=>anything},
  805:     #s{map=Map,t={x,y}} = do_match_map(#s{map=Map}),
  806:     {a,#{k:={a,b,c}}} = do_match_map_2(#{k=>{a,b,c}}),
  807:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,whatever},_}} = catch do_match_map_none(id(whatever)),
  808:     ok.
  809: 
  810: do_match_map(#s{map=#{key:=Val}}=S) ->
  811:     %% Would crash with a 'badarg' exception.
  812:     S#s{t=Val}.
  813: 
  814: do_match_map_2(Map) ->
  815:     case {a,Map} of
  816: 	{a,#{k:=_}}=Tuple ->
  817: 	    Tuple
  818:     end.
  819: 
  820: do_match_map_none(V) ->
  821:     %% Cover handling of has_map_fields in beam_validator.
  822:     #{42 := _} = try
  823:                      {} = {{} = V}
  824:                  catch
  825:                      throw:V ->
  826:                          #{};
  827:                      throw:_ ->
  828:                          V
  829:                  end.
  830: 
  831: map_vars_used(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  832:     {some,value} = do_map_vars_used(a, b, #{{a,b}=>42,v=>{some,value}}),
  833:     ok.
  834: 
  835: do_map_vars_used(X, Y, Map) ->
  836:     case {X,Y} of
  837: 	T ->
  838: 	    %% core_lib:is_var_used/2 would not consider T used.
  839: 	    #{T:=42,v:=Val} = Map,
  840: 	    Val
  841:     end.
  842: 
  843: -record(coverage_id, {bool=false,id}).
  844: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  845:     %% Cover beam_dead.
  846:     ok = coverage_1(x, a),
  847:     ok = coverage_1(x, b),
  848: 
  849:     %% Cover sys_pre_expand.
  850:     ok = coverage_3("abc"),
  851: 
  852:     %% Cover beam_ssa_dead.
  853:     {expr,key} = coverage_4([literal,get], [[expr,key]]),
  854:     {expr,key} = coverage_4([expr,key], []),
  855: 
  856:     a = coverage_5([8,8,8], #coverage_id{bool=true}),
  857:     b = coverage_5([], #coverage_id{bool=true}),
  858: 
  859:     %% Cover beam_ssa_opt.
  860:     ok = coverage_6(),
  861: 
  862:     %% Cover beam_ssa_dead.
  863:     a = coverage_7(x, x, id(true)),
  864:     b = coverage_7(x, 0, id(false)),
  865: 
  866:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,{42}},_}} = catch coverage_8(id(42)),
  867: 
  868:     error = coverage_9(id(1)),
  869:     true = coverage_9(id(0)),
  870: 
  871:     ok.
  872: 
  873: coverage_1(B, Tag) ->
  874:     case Tag of
  875: 	a -> coverage_2(1, a, B);
  876: 	b -> coverage_2(2, b, B)
  877:     end.
  878: 
  879: coverage_2(1, a, x) -> ok;
  880: coverage_2(2, b, x) -> ok.
  881: 
  882: coverage_3([$a]++[]++"bc") -> ok.
  883: 
  884: %% Cover beam_ssa_dead:eval_type_test_1(is_nonempty_list, Arg).
  885: coverage_4([literal,get], [Expr]) ->
  886:     coverage_4(Expr, []);
  887: coverage_4([Expr,Key], []) ->
  888:     {Expr,Key}.
  889: 
  890: %% Cover beam_ssa_dead:eval_type_test_1(is_tagged_tuple, Arg).
  891: coverage_5(Config, TermId)
  892:   when TermId =:= #coverage_id{bool=true},
  893:        Config =:= [8,8,8] ->
  894:     a;
  895: coverage_5(_Config, #coverage_id{bool=true}) ->
  896:     b.
  897: 
  898: coverage_6() ->
  899:     X = 17,
  900:     case
  901:         case id(1) > 0 of
  902:             true ->
  903:                 17;
  904:             false ->
  905:                 42
  906:         end
  907:     of
  908:         X ->
  909:             ok;
  910:         V ->
  911:             %% Cover beam_ssa_opt:make_literal/2.
  912:             error([error,X,V])
  913:     end.
  914: 
  915: %% Cover beam_ssa_dead:opt_switch_1/3.
  916: coverage_7(_, _, true)  ->
  917:     a;
  918: coverage_7(_, 0, false)  ->
  919:     b;
  920: coverage_7(_, _, true)  ->
  921:     c.
  922: 
  923: %% Cover beam_ssa_dead:will_succeed_*
  924: coverage_8(V) ->
  925:     V =/= (V = {V}).
  926: 
  927: coverage_9(V) when V == 0 ->
  928:     -1 /= try ok of
  929:               _ ->
  930:                   V
  931:           catch
  932:               _ ->
  933:                   ok
  934:           end;
  935: coverage_9(_) ->
  936:     error.
  937: 
  938: grab_bag(_Config) ->
  939:     [_|T] = id([a,b,c]),
  940:     [b,c] = id(T),
  941: 
  942:     T1 = fun() ->
  943: 		 [_|_] = x
  944: 	 end,
  945:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch T1()),
  946: 
  947:     T2 = fun(A, B) ->
  948: 		 case {{element(1, A),element(2, B)},
  949: 		       {element(2, A),element(2, B)}} of
  950: 		     {Same,Same} -> ok;
  951: 		     {{0,1},{up,X}} -> id(X);
  952: 		     {_,{X,_}} -> id(X)
  953: 		 end
  954: 	 end,
  955:     ok = T2({a,a,z,z}, {z,a,z}),
  956:     1 = T2({0,up}, {zzz,1}),
  957:     y = T2({x,y}, {a,z,z}),
  958: 
  959:     %% OTP-5244.
  960:     L = [{stretch,0,0},
  961: 	 {bad,[]},
  962: 	 {bad,atom},
  963: 	 {bad,0},
  964: 	 {bad,16#AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA},
  965: 	 {bad,16#555555555555555555555555555555555555555555555555555}],
  966:     ok = grab_bag_remove_failure(L, unit, 0),
  967: 
  968:     {42,<<43,44>>} = grab_bag_single_valued(<<42,43,44>>),
  969:     empty_list = grab_bag_single_valued([]),
  970:     empty_tuple = grab_bag_single_valued({}),
  971: 
  972:     ok.
  973: 
  974: grab_bag_remove_failure([], _Unit, _MaxFailure) ->
  975:     ok;
  976: grab_bag_remove_failure([{bad,Bad}|_], _Unit, _MaxFailure) ->
  977:     Bad;
  978: grab_bag_remove_failure([{stretch,_,Mi}=Stretch | Specs], Unit, _MaxFailure) ->
  979:     {MinMax,NewMaxFailure} = id({min,1}),
  980:     case {MinMax,grab_bag_remove_failure(Specs, Unit, NewMaxFailure)} of
  981: 	{min,{NewMaxFailure,Rest}} ->
  982: 	    {done,[{fixed,Mi} | Rest]};
  983: 	{min,_} when Specs =/= [] ->
  984: 	    grab_bag_remove_failure([Stretch|tl(Specs)], Unit, NewMaxFailure);
  985: 	{min,_} ->
  986: 	    ok
  987:     end.
  988: 
  989: %% Cover a line v3_kernel that places binary matching first.
  990: grab_bag_single_valued(<<H,T/bytes>>) -> {H,T};
  991: grab_bag_single_valued([]) -> empty_list;
  992: grab_bag_single_valued({}) -> empty_tuple.
  993: 
  994: 
  995: %% Regression in 19.0, reported by Alexei Sholik
  996: literal_binary(_Config) ->
  997:     3 = literal_binary_match(bar, <<"y">>),
  998: 
  999:     %% While we are at it, also test the remaining code paths
 1000:     %% in literal_binary_match/2.
 1001:     1 = literal_binary_match(bar, <<"x">>),
 1002:     2 = literal_binary_match(foo, <<"x">>),
 1003:     3 = literal_binary_match(foo, <<"y">>),
 1004:     fail = literal_binary_match(bar, <<"z">>),
 1005:     fail = literal_binary_match(foo, <<"z">>),
 1006:     ok.
 1007: 
 1008: literal_binary_match(bar, <<"x">>) -> 1;
 1009: literal_binary_match(_, <<"x">>) -> 2;
 1010: literal_binary_match(_, <<"y">>) -> 3;
 1011: literal_binary_match(_, _) -> fail.
 1012: 
 1013: unary_op(Config) ->
 1014:     %% ERL-514. This test case only verifies that the code
 1015:     %% calculates the correct result, not that the generated
 1016:     %% code is optimial.
 1017: 
 1018:     {non_associative,30} = unary_op_1('&'),
 1019:     {non_associative,300} = unary_op_1('^'),
 1020:     {non_associative,300} = unary_op_1('not'),
 1021:     {non_associative,300} = unary_op_1('+'),
 1022:     {non_associative,300} = unary_op_1('-'),
 1023:     {non_associative,300} = unary_op_1('~~~'),
 1024:     {non_associative,300} = unary_op_1('!'),
 1025:     {non_associative,320} = unary_op_1('@'),
 1026: 
 1027:     error = unary_op_1(Config),
 1028:     error = unary_op_1(abc),
 1029:     error = unary_op_1(42),
 1030: 
 1031:     ok.
 1032: 
 1033: unary_op_1(Vop@1) ->
 1034:     %% If all optimizations are working as they should, there should
 1035:     %% be no stack frame and all '=:=' tests should be coalesced into
 1036:     %% a single select_val instruction.
 1037: 
 1038:     case Vop@1 =:= '&' of
 1039:         true ->
 1040:             {non_associative,30};
 1041:         false ->
 1042:             case
 1043:                 case Vop@1 =:= '^' of
 1044:                     true ->
 1045:                         true;
 1046:                     false ->
 1047:                         case Vop@1 =:= 'not' of
 1048:                             true ->
 1049:                                 true;
 1050:                             false ->
 1051:                                 case Vop@1 =:= '+' of
 1052:                                     true ->
 1053:                                         true;
 1054:                                     false ->
 1055:                                         case Vop@1 =:= '-' of
 1056:                                             true ->
 1057:                                                 true;
 1058:                                             false ->
 1059:                                                 case Vop@1 =:= '~~~' of
 1060:                                                     true ->
 1061:                                                         true;
 1062:                                                     false ->
 1063:                                                         Vop@1 =:= '!'
 1064:                                                 end
 1065:                                         end
 1066:                                 end
 1067:                         end
 1068:                 end
 1069:             of
 1070:                 true ->
 1071:                     {non_associative,300};
 1072:                 false ->
 1073:                     case Vop@1 =:= '@' of
 1074:                         true ->
 1075:                             {non_associative,320};
 1076:                         false ->
 1077:                             error
 1078:                     end
 1079:             end
 1080:     end.
 1081: 
 1082: eq_types(_Config) ->
 1083:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1084:     Ref = eq_types(Ref, any),
 1085:     ok.
 1086: 
 1087: eq_types(A, B) ->
 1088:     %% {put_tuple2,{y,0},{list,[{x,0},{x,1}]}}.
 1089:     Term0 = {A, B},
 1090:     Term = id(Term0),
 1091: 
 1092:     %% {test,is_eq_exact,{f,3},[{y,0},{x,0}]}.
 1093:     %% Here beam_validator must infer that {x,0} has the
 1094:     %% same type as {y,0}.
 1095:     Term = Term0,
 1096: 
 1097:     %% {get_tuple_element,{x,0},0,{x,0}}.
 1098:     {Ref22,_} = Term,
 1099: 
 1100:     Ref22.
 1101: 
 1102: match_after_return(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1103:     %% The return type of the following call will never match the 'wont_happen'
 1104:     %% clauses below, and the beam_ssa_type was clever enough to see that but
 1105:     %% didn't remove the blocks, so it crashed when trying to extract A.
 1106:     ok = case mar_test_tuple(erlang:unique_integer()) of
 1107:             {gurka, never_matches, A} -> {wont_happen, A};
 1108:             _ -> ok
 1109:          end.
 1110: 
 1111: mar_test_tuple(I) -> {gurka, I}.
 1112: 
 1113: match_right_tuple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1114:     %% The loader wrongly coalesced certain get_tuple_element sequences, fusing
 1115:     %% the code below into a single i_get_tuple_element2 operating on {x,0}
 1116:     %% even though the first one overwrites it.
 1117:     %%
 1118:     %%    {get_tuple_element,{x,0},0,{x,0}}.
 1119:     %%    {get_tuple_element,{x,0},1,{x,1}}.
 1120: 
 1121:     Inner = {id(wrong_element), id(ok)},
 1122:     Outer = {Inner, id(wrong_tuple)},
 1123:     ok = match_right_tuple_1(Outer).
 1124: 
 1125: match_right_tuple_1(T) ->
 1126:     {A, _} = T,
 1127:     {_, B} = A,
 1128:     %% The call ensures that A is in {x,0} and B is in {x,1}
 1129:     id(force_succ_regs(A, B)).
 1130: 
 1131: force_succ_regs(_A, B) -> B.
 1132: 
 1133: tuple_size_in_try(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1134:     %% The tuple_size optimization was applied outside of guards, causing
 1135:     %% either the emulator or compiler to crash.
 1136:     ok = tsit(gurka),
 1137:     ok = tsit(gaffel).
 1138: 
 1139: tsit(A) ->
 1140:     try
 1141:         id(ignored),
 1142:         1 = tuple_size(A),
 1143:         error
 1144:     catch
 1145:         _:_ -> ok
 1146:     end.
 1147: 
 1148: match_boolean_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1149:     BoolList = [N rem 2 =:= 0 || N <- lists:seq(1, 8)],
 1150:     %% The compiler knows that all list elements are booleans, so it translates
 1151:     %% the expression below to a #b_br{} on the list head.
 1152:     %%
 1153:     %% This is fine, but since the value was only used in that branch,
 1154:     %% reserve_zregs/3 (pre_codegen) would place the variable in a z register,
 1155:     %% crashing the compiler in a later pass.
 1156:     ok = case BoolList of
 1157:              [true | _] -> error;
 1158:              [false | _] -> ok
 1159:          end.
 1160: 
 1161: 
 1162: heisen_variables(_Config) ->
 1163:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,3},_}} = catch gh_6516_scope1(),
 1164:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,3},_}} = catch gh_6516_scope2(),
 1165: 
 1166:     ok.
 1167: 
 1168: gh_6516_scope1() ->
 1169:     {X = 4, X = 3}.
 1170: 
 1171: gh_6516_scope2() ->
 1172:   {X = 4, _ = X = 3}.
 1173: 
 1174: %% GH-6873. Bound variables would be overwritten.
 1175: mutable_variables(_Config) ->
 1176:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,0},_}} = catch mutable_variables_1(),
 1177: 
 1178:     F = fun() -> id({tag,whatever}) end,
 1179:     whatever = mutable_variables_2(id({tag,whatever}), F),
 1180:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,{tag,whatever}},_}} = catch mutable_variables_2(id(a), F),
 1181: 
 1182:     ok.
 1183: 
 1184: mutable_variables_1() ->
 1185:     Zero = 0,
 1186:     One = 1,
 1187:     Result = One = Zero,
 1188:     {Result,One,Zero}.
 1189: 
 1190: mutable_variables_2(Middle, Fun) ->
 1191:     {tag,V} = Middle = Fun(),
 1192:     V.
 1193: 
 1194: 
 1195: id(I) -> I.
